required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: 68Ga-FAPI PET/CT in Patients With Various Fibrotic Disease
clinical_study.official_title: 68Ga-DOTA/NOTA-FAPI PET/CT in Patients With Various Fibrotic Disease

lead_sponsor.agency: First Affiliated Hospital of Fujian Medical University

clinical_study.source: First Affiliated Hospital of Fujian Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the potential value of 68Ga-FAPI-04 positron emission tomography/ computed tomography (PET/CT) for the diagnosis and prognosis in fibrotic disease

detailed_description.textblock: Subjects with fibrotic disease underwent 68Ga-FAPI-04 PET/CT scanning. Fibrosis lesion uptake was quantified by the maximum standard uptake value (SUVmax). Subjects also received the conventional clinical assessment for liver fibrosis, such as magnetic resonance imaging(MRI) , biopsy and blood biochemical indexes (BBI) testing. The sensitivity, specificity, positive predictive value (PPV), negative predictive value (NPV) and accuracy of 68Ga-FAPI-04 PET/CT, MRI and BBI were calculated and compared to evaluate the diagnostic efficacy.

primary_outcome.description: Standardized uptake value (SUV) of 68Ga-DOTA/NOTA-FAPI-04 for each target lesion of subject.

secondary_outcome.description: The sensitivity, specificity and accuracy of 68Ga-DOTA/NOTA-FAPI-04 PET/CT were calculated.

arm_group.description: Each subject receive a single intravenous injection of 68Ga-DOTA/NOTA-FAPI-04, and undergo PET/CT imaging within the specificed time.

intervention.description: Each subject receive a single intravenous injection of 68Ga-FAPI-04, and undergo PET/CT scanning within the specified time.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- adult patients (aged 18 years or order)
- patients with suspected or new diagnosed fibrotic disease (supporting evidence may include , BBI, MRI, CT and pathology report)
- patients who had scheduled 68Ga-FAPI-04 PET/CT scan
- patients who were able to provide informed consent (signed by participant, parent or legal representative) and assent according to the guidelines of the Clinical Research Ethics Committee
Exclusion Criteria:
- patients with pregnancy
- the inability or unwillingness of the research participant, parent or legal representative to provide written informed consent

facility.name: Department of Nuclear Medicine, First Affiliated Hospital of Fujian Medical University

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: First Affiliated Hospital of Fujian Medical University
